Negombo is a coastal gem with a unique blend of history and vibrant beach life. The town's golden sands, lined with palm trees, offer a perfect spot to unwind, while the gentle waves invite you for a refreshing dip. One of the highlights is the sight of traditional fishing boats, a nod to Negombo's rich maritime heritage. Its vibrant history is reflected in landmarks like the Old Dutch Fort, adding a touch of the past to your visit. Whether you're savouring fresh seafood or simply enjoying the sunset, Negombo beautifully captures the essence of Sri Lankan coastal charm. Plus, being just a few minutes from the airport, reaching this coastal area is incredibly easy.

I visited in June when it was humid, but I visited at sunset, when the evening sea breeze made the humidity bearable. As I moved along the Negombo Beach Road, I could see that the Beach extended over an extensive distance. Negombo Beach is famous for its expansive, gentle golden shore. I saw families enjoying beach games but the cherry on the cake was the groups of friends jamming. Their small cars were packed with a sound system, and they had basic musical instruments themselves using which they produced beautiful, peppy music, setting the note for the evening. After listening to the jam for a few minutes, I took a walk on the pure Negombo Beach. In mild weather, I could imagine sightseers using it as an exceptional spot for morning relaxation, tanning or, like me, enjoying a relaxed evening. Being in the vicinity of the airport, Negombo Beach becomes a perfect place to relax before boarding your flight back home. It is full of charming gems to discover. I could see why it is a prevalent attraction of this sea town.

Sri Lanka is just getting back on its feet after covid and then a bomb attack decimated the tourist industry. This is an excellent time to visit. People are desperate for tourists to come and are very welcoming.  The exchange rate is also very attractive…we got 406 rupees/£ at the airport which is the best place to exchange. We stayed at the Heritance hotel for 5 nights  at the end of our three week visit. The hotel was excellent. This is the Main Street  of Negombo and is gradually coming to life as restaurants and shops get busier. The place looks better at night when everything is lit up. There are many tourist souvenir shops and bars restaurants. Terrific value for money. Our fav restaurant was Boho half way up the street and then Prego right across the road from the hotel. There are other restaurants highlighted on Apple Maps but either had changed name or have yet to reopen. Heritance have developed a restaurant and Swiss cafe right across from the hotel. In our 5 days there we didn’t see anyone use either. The restaurant has a Middle Eastern menu, I suggest this was a big part of the problem. The souvenir shops we used all offered discounts without asking.  We loved Diane’s just across from the Gelato cafe. We met the owner and it turned out she had visited U.K. and Edinburgh where we come from. Lovely lady…give her your business. We also used Maya which had some great hippy chic clothes but the staff need a shake to get them away from their phone screens….it was also full of moths and mozzies the night we were there. The beach itself is public so you share it all with the locals and it gets very busy at weekends. During the week it’s perfect for some yoga on the beach early morning or just walking off breakfast. You will get approached by tat sellers but just be polite but firm. Don’t be rude, they’re just trying to make a living. Finally the folk have seen really hard times over the last few years. So be prepared to tip. A little goes a long way for them. If we are at a small hotel we will “adopt” a waiter or pool guy and ensure they get a decent tip at the end of our stay. If we all did that it would make a huge difference to their families and be a great incentive to improve their understanding of service. Go, you’ll love it.

I would not swim In the sea as raw sewage is discharged in to the waters. I agree with this statement. If you want to get sick swim in the sea. The resturant was please take enough but over priced for what it was
Very nice beach, water not very clean but perfect for walks and watching crabs :) Not many places on the beach itself so it makes for a rare view of quite untouched beach with palm trees.
This beach cannot be compared to the beaches in the south. do nit spend your time there. There is not much to do in Negombo, it is only a layover.

Since our flight was landing midnight at Colombo airport, we decided to give Negombo a try as it was closer to the airport than Colombo. The only thing worth doing in Negombo was the beach so we decided to head to the beach after having our breakfast. The beach is very small and mostly dirty. You will be troubled with people trying to lure you for a pathetic boat ride. This beach is mostly for locals. There are some local snacks shops and ice cream trucks here. Most of the beach is tarred with trash and after every 20 meters someone will approach you for boat ride or try to sell you something. That's another buzzkill. You can spend around half an hour to one hour here but nothing more. We found beaches in Bentota much better than Negombo.

This was the first beach that we visited in Sri Lanka. We only really came here because we found a reasonable deal to stay at a hotel on this beach for our first few days whilst we recovered from jet lag. It isn't too far from the airport so we thought it could be a good choice. The beach did look nice from the balcony of our hotel. But unfortunately when you actually walk on to it, upon closer inspection, it is covered in small bits of plastic. A sad sign of our times... As we walked along we saw quite a lot of rubbish blowing around too. Expect sellers to approach you the second you set foot on the sand. Just as one finally leaves you alone, the next one heads towards you. So it's hard to have much peace. But at least they always seem polite. But it is a bit off putting if you just want a peaceful walk. The water is quite rough here so only strong swimmers would fancy going in the water. Nice to look at in the distance from your hotel. But very disappointing once you actually head out onto it, which is a real shame. We wouldn't go back.

This beach is really nice for swimming, it’s clean. Pleasant walk on the beach. We were there on the full moon, locals were having a party, it was great to see. You find some sellers on the beach, they can tag along but be firm and let them down. Make sure you bring their price down.also you find there are some stalls on the beach which sell food, we didn’t try It’s a great beach to chill and enjoy the sunset
A nice beach, some nice bars and restaurants to get refreshments if you want. Beach is sandy and quite wide. Lots of families swimming so assume a good place, although didn’t swim ourselves

I was just here for a couple of days and there was a fair amount of garage on the beach. Maybe during the tourist season they clean it up. While running I went north, running along the street, until I could cut in to Browns Beach, which was cleaner.
Not a place to lounge around to catch rays. It was a dirty beach and had locals trying to sell you beaded jewellery or sarongs. There are better beaches South of the island.
Very nice beach with white soft sand & most of all clean. Stretching for about 2kms & evening is the place time of the day to be there. Plenty of restaurants nearby to indulge your taste buds...

I spent my last day & a half here & although I enjoyed it (somewhat) I wouldn’t waste more than a day. Parts of the beach I might describe as nice but then there were other parts particularly around the fishing boats where there was a lot of plastic & other litter strewn about which made it all look sad. The locals just don’t seem to notice it. Some good value restaurants along the main strip though.
Negombo beach is small but beautiful . There are lot of hotels near the beach and one can enjoy a crowd-free pleasant stay .
Good place to stay before or after a flight but as far as Sri Lanka’s beaches are... don’t waste time here.

Spent a few days on the beach whilst staying in Negombo with my then girlfriend. It's a nice enough beach to relax on and/or have a swim. There are also a few bars dotted along the beach that also serve food. We spent a couple of evenings sipping on some Lions and watching the sunset
It's close to the our home town and i went with family may times. My kids enjoyed more. We love to negombo  beach. its our life.

Very Close to Negombo town, 12 Km's from Katunayake International Airport, famous hotels and beach hotels are there, St. Sebastiyan church, Dutch cancels are famous places among tourists very close to beach road, Negombo Beach park is very famous among the loacals, as well as tourist, it will be crowded in weekends,

This is one of the best beaches I have experienced in visits.Love the climate and the very peaceful and relaxing in the evening.Kind of wow..Road side foods are awesome.Everyone can enjoy from kids to grand parents. Calm place to have a sentimental mind set with a cool beer.Romantic.Visiting almost every month
Its a beautiful busy beach near by the airport area of colombo...nice beach with sun,sea and the sand.

The negombo beach is the best beach I have recently visited . This is my first time in Srilanka and the 1st place I visited is the beach. Its beautiful tranquil and calm though its hot  I enjoyed it very much
I have been here maybe 25 times and the restaurant must be the best in Sri Lanka.. if you like Sri Lanka stile,  spicy mmmm Karin and me love it!

Beautiful beach, but very dirty. We had trouble finding a decent enough space to sunbathe. Also the locals are sometimes quite agressive in trying to sell you stuff. We had to be pretty rude ourselves in order to get some peace. But if you’re there, make sure to catch the sunset. Quite spectacular.
Very dirty and not so nice sand. Sometimes beautiful sunsets. Not possible to make long beach walks because sometimes you cant cross the vegetation
The beach is lovely the sand is so warm to walk on. I enjoyed my time here walking. And evening strolls.The seas were very rough and it was impossible to swim.

Hi, Its nice brown beach of Sri Lanka and every one can get real experience in Fishing, Markets , Beach , Sea Bathing , Wild life (Birds Watching) Shopping and all includes around 2,3 KM range. Recommend to visit and enjoy . Good Luck.
The beach was really beautiful and Sun set was eye catching.. if u come to Sri Lanka u must not forget to experience cool breezes at beach..

This beach is absolutely filthy and covered in litter. It’s such a shame this is one of the first places travellers see/stay due to the proximity to the airport. I would avoid staying spending much time here if possible.

the beach is very wide with attached hotels and restaurants, safety measures not found. tide comes with slopy surface which is not good for kids and those who are good in swimming. sand is reasonable. provision of washrooms, pre/post bathing are available or not appropriate  in general

We visited here for 3 days and we thought with all the reviews that the beach wasn’t very nice. we thought differently, we enjoyed a few walks along the beach with the stray dogs and unique boats. Not the best  beach for swimming but great spot for watching the local kids play cricket and fly kites, also nice for sunsets.
....Was a great way to start, and end, the day.   I enjoyed putting my toes in the sand and feeling the waves on my feet.   I felt safe on my beach walks.

This would beach would have got a much higher rating if it wasnt for the amount if plastic and trash you found washed up along the shore, and in the water. this beach is not recommended for sun bathing as it has lots of garbage all over place. recommended only for walks and experiencing the fishing community. the only places with a clean piece of sand are those in front of the large hotels. the best beaches are in the south and east coasts.
I think our hotel cleans the beach area around us. The  beach could be very nice as soon as they clean it up, everywhere.

You do not want to stay in Negombo for a longer period of time. One night will suffice. Recover from your flight and get away from here. The beach in Negombo is wide but there is very little to do. Travel on...
Don't recommend this beach, probably good for fishing, but definitely not for beaching, full of garbage, only in front of some hotels are a little bit cleaner.
Negombo beach nice.... But can't swimming... Water little bit polluted..... Very carm place... They have lots of local shops.... Foods are very cheap... But not good quality.......

Really sad to see how people treat nature. A walk on the beach feels like walking on a trash field. If they don’t do it for nature than hopefully they do it for tourism, because not a tourist in this world likes to walk on a beach this dirty, horrible!

I was only walking on the beach. I haven’t spotted anyone dip into the ocean. There are some spots with lot of garage and some without any rubbish. The water seems to be rough so this might be a reason why there was nobody or maybe because of the climate then.

A casual beach, for a walk with the sound of waves. Generally warm with breeze. Locals and visitors should be more aware on the cleanliness as there are so much dirt of plastics on the shore. Experience may vary with the time of the year.

Was delighted today to discover this food festival to be held at Negombo Beach Park this weekend. Great to see new initatives like this one popping up on the beach in Negombo. Can't wait to attend.

A must visit place, the sky is like no where the sea is beautiful, it's a good place for meditation and serenity.

Reviewer Name: Lanka Tours by Lanka Tour Driver
Review Text: Negombo is a popular destination for tourists with its pristine beaches, historic canals, lagoons and other breathtaking views. The Porutota stretch has been known for its mushrooming pubs and restaurants for quite a long time. Since many of the star class hotels are also found along this street local businesses too are having quite a potential with tourists walking in to them almost all the time. Shops selling souvenirs shops, swimming accessories, clothes are also found in addition to the pubs and cafes. In an attempt to find out some of the happening places in town, the Life Online walked in to a few known places to taste some of their signature dishes. We also didn’t forget to visit some of the iconic landmarks in town including the fish market, the lagoons and other sacred places of worship. Stay there for overnight and rest if you have a late arrival to Srilanka for a round trip.. its the suitable suggestion to start the late night arrival round tours around Srilanka .. also compared to the Colombo accommodations are better and cheap in Negombo .. The negambo beach is ideal for walks and swimming. Very less stones. You also have many hotels and restaurants in the beach area.

I arrived at Negombo beach at 1 pm ... The beach had lots of boats on the shore... There were plenty of beach side resorts and a few restaurants on the beach to grab something to eat... Due to hide tide starting in frst week of may it wasn’t preferable to swim but still you can enjoy the ocean views from a distance. The shore of the beach was not that clean but i had a nice time just taking pictures with the boats and hanging around for a while.... i didn’t spend more then an 2 hours near the beach.....

Pleasantly surprised how wide and clean the beach is. The fishing boats add charm and the sea was calm and tepid. There isn’t much shade - so make sure you have a hat and plenty of sun screen on hand. Better still take a stroll at sunset ... There is a pretty (and shady) lotus pool at one of the entrances ... and an ice cream truck from which you can indulge if the mood strikes. Stay at one of the beachside hotels and you get the best of both worlds!

Such a beautiful clean beach in Negombo. We had a wonderful evening in the sunset playing with the tide and walking along the beach in the white sand which gets wet time to time with tides coming up. There are places where you can even have a safe dip. Perfect for a evening outing with the family or with friends. Highly recommend.
I would't call it the most beautiful but we enjoy visiting beaches from around the world.  This happened to be one.
The beach is full of rubbish coming from the nearby creeks. It is a pity because the beach has some potential. Please clean up the beach and stop throwing your plastic everywhere.

The beach at Negombo is just ok. There is a lot of rubbish on the beach but most of it is cleaned up each morning by a tractor. Even after the clean up there is still a far bit I’d waste left. You would only go to this beach if you are staying in one of the hotels along it after or before your flight. It’s not a place I would visit for the beach alone.  In saying that we swam there each day we were there. The water was pretty good in the mornings but by the afternoon there was a lot of debris floating in it. It’s not the kind of beach where you go and lay on it like we do in Australia. The sand is course and there is the rubbish issue.  The other thing to contend with are the hawkers trying to sell your their wares and the boat owners wanting to take you for a boat trip.  It’s an ok beach if you are there but don’t go out of your way to visit.

After coming from the Maldives, any beach would pale in comparison. However; there was lots of litter on the beach, and we had to consistently have to say "no" to the hoards of people trying to sell us nick nacks.
Very happy to be here when here you feel you too a fisherman that much of seafood business. Very much of activity’s like it enjoy

The beach is a little different to those on Aussie shores. It gets cleaned daily, is frequented by hawkers and there are lots of stray dogs. The dogs won’t bother you. The hawkers will. However, they are a polite nation and are just trying to earn a living. If you’re not interested, a polite no is all it takes. The sea is incredibly warm but those waves are strong so please watch out for your little ones.
There is t loads to do at the beach other than sit on the sand as there are no chairs other than with the hotels

The beach is full of plastic and other waste. No shadow. Fishermen and other locals staring at you. Sri Lanka has beautiful beaches to offer (e.g. Mirissa, Tangalle), but do yourself a favor an skip this one.

Golden sand beach, normally completely empty without most of the things necessary to enjoy a beach, unless you are in one the hotel’s with entrance to the beach. Lack of things to do. Lack of activities, restaurants, etc.

definitely the worst beach at sri lanka, trash all over. maybe 500 crows trying to find food.. there is maybe 100 better beach in lanka.. so skip it. or you can rent a room for 300-400€ and stay behind fence in jetwing.. sunset is only beatiful thing in that beach.
I definitely expected a little more from that beach, though the sunsets were beautiful. The sand was more of a brownish color, and not as soft as I thought.
I love the beach. It’s quite clean and there’s a play area for kids too. Go out into the sea and check out the ‘shipwreck’ and the corals.
Negombo just N of SL airport, beautiful beach that seemed perfect for sailing & windsurfing..Didn’t notice any swimmers, Just a few sunbathers.

We stayed in Negombo for one night for our layover. The beach was nice, however, we had a dead cat wash up ashore right in front of us and a few meters down another dead dried  up cat from the sun. As you can probably tell the beach wasn’t very clean. Otherwise beautiful views.
Whilst it good for a stroll, there is just too much litter for me. The sand is a light brown and slightly coarse. The are a few polite touts to keep you on your toes.

Very disappointing beach. Extremely dirty with rubbish everywhere. Dead fish, wood, plastic, household rubbish, and more both on the beach and in the sea. A distinct lack of beach restaurants/shacks, sun loungers. Only locals selling their wares. We were appalled by the litter and lack of cleanliness on a beach in such a tourist area.

A beautiful stretch of beach several miles long completely ruined by the amount of rubbish strewn across the whole length of it. Plastic of all descriptions from tooth brushes to old toys, and of course many many plastic bottles.  Also glass bottles whole and smashed,  as well as other detritus.  Yet worse than this from the wild life perspective is the bits of old fish nets and lines scattered all over the place. A real danger to all forms of marine life. Feral dogs run loose and defecate everywhere,  worse still my wife witnessed a local also defecating on the edge of the water. A half-hearted attempt is made to clean the beach by use of a tractor and sand scoop but does not cover even half the beach leaving most of the beach untouched. Saw one so called recycling bin that was used as a general rubbish bin, apart from that there appears no attempt to recycle any of this mess. At one point a stream runs across the beach then out to sea that smells strongly of sweage . There is also a small pond that also smells the same. All the beach bars  and hotels that front onto this stretch of sand serve all their drinks with plastic straws and there are thousands of them every where you look on what should be a lovely natural space. So if you do walk on this beach keep your saddles on
Negombo is a sandy beach with muddy waters. No shade to be found. Only got approached by one seller. This beach needs a clean, dead cats and rubbish filtering into the sea .

Groups of young men playing beach volleyball and others kicking a soccer ball around.  A few female vendors approached us but we said "no thank you" and they left us alone. Two weeks later, we walked to the beach in the morning near the Heritance Hotel and were immediately barraged by people offering tours, boat rides, and souvenirs.  We had wanted to take a nice quiet stroll by the water but left after 10 minutes because it got unbearably annoying because the vendors kept following us.   The sand itself is a tan color and the water seemed clean.  Not the powdery soft white sand and crystal blue clear water that we associate with the South Pacific.

Great beach to swim in and very clean. Fantastic sunsets. Very romantic setting for couples. Children can play freely and there are always locals on the beach playing volleyball and softball and they always enjoy foreigners joining in.

really nice beach to wander on - just a issue we had with the amount of drift plastic washed up most of it not created in sri lanka but brought here by the indian ocean - a shame clean up operations do not seem to be in place would make it a wonderful destination

We loveed this beach. It's wide and the sand is very fine. There were some boats adding charm and authenticity. Waves were rather high but the water was really  warm and pleasant.

The beach would be nice if it wasn't full of rubbish like bottle lids other plastic and paper. This is a very very touristy beach and dosnt have that wow factor that other beaches have in Sri lanka (go to bentota instead) you also get hassled by the locals wanting you to buy thing or go on there boats that look like they are about to fall apart.

It was really pleasant just wandering the beach. The locals were friendly and although some wanted to get you to GI for a ride in their boats or sell you something no one was pushy or annoying. The ocean looked beautiful and very tempting. Good way to start the day.

We came to beach to relax on the first day on our arrival to srilanka and we stayed on the last day which quite near to the airport. Good place to have a walk and swim and good seafood restaurants are nearby u can choose all of sea fish varieties. Recommended!
Absolutely a clean and beautiful beach that goes on for miles. Great for watching the sun set and picnics and just relaxing. Good for the entire family.
The seas were very rough and it was impossible  to swim. There are no amenities on the beach and no shade. I knocked over by the first wave when I was only knee deep.

Of course it doesn’t hurt that some of the best restaurants and shopping can be found on the road that runs along the beach. Very nice beach. Not only for tourists. Many locals swim here. Quite clean and nice. Many cafe's and restaurants near

Not a bad beach. Clean enough, big enough, fab sunset, some beach bars although service a bit mayhem, see some local activity.

It it pretty nice beach. Wild n wawy, but u can just walk n stop by. In the mroning till noon, u wont get bothered by much locals coz its the hottest time if the day. Negombo city is about 45 minutes by car to the North of Colombo.  The international airport serving Colombo and hence Sri Lanka is located there.  So all international travelers arriving by flight pass through Negombo. The city itself is quite large, populous and developed with all amenities such as modern hotels, shopping, very reasonably priced AirBnB accommodations  etc. However, there are just a handful of sightseeing locations such as the fish market, church etc. which are really not much to speak of, in my opinion. Negombo has a long sandy beach with spectacular sunset views. The tourism industry has grown around highlighting Negombo as a beach destination.  During my visit, I walked quite a bit up and down, along the beach and found raw sewage from the city flow directly into the sea, at many different locations. I am a Chemical and Mechanical Engineer and have worked in the Environmental field for the past 32 years.  I can state with a great degree of confidence that the waters in the Negombo beach area are definitely polluted to a large extent, with fecal coli form bacteria and certainly other harmful pollutants. In fairness, the infrastructure for tourists along the beach is quite good with many reasonably priced restaurants and bars. For someone seeking a somewhat cheap beach vacation, Negombo may barely pass as the place of choice   With Sri Lanka as an island nation, there are many other beach destinations which are far better at equivalent cost.

This nice beach have a lot of sandbeach.. and you can see when the fishermens push there boat out of the water and take fish out of the nets... but waste make the visit not perfect. plasticwaste, empty drinkingbotles, dead fish on the beach get my visit to not be that expirience, i had wished.
It is nice beach with fishermans ships. This beach is quite clean comparing with some other beaches in Sri Lanka.
What a pity could be a lovely beach but lots of rubbish and not looked after. Maybe it was because it is June and off season

Negombo beach is near to Airport, less than 15 minute. Because of the all issues of roads in Sri Lanka, I do recommend you to Stay in this city for your first day and last day. Airport to Colombo is about 1 hour, however there is a highway but its not like what you may have seen before :) At the other hand, beach is very clean and safe. there are a lot of entertainment and spas ... so enjoy it :)

Negombo beach lives up to pretty much everything that we read in the guide books. On the one hand, it is lovely, stepping out for the first time (if you’ve come straight to Negombo from your flight) to see tropical seas and wind-swept palm trees. On the other hand, its pretty dirty, and after a short walk along, you may find yourself hounded by beggars or peddlers (I can only speak for the evening, it may be different during other times of day). Do not be put off though, the majority of Sri lanka is not like this and it is still worth a brief visit.

Negombo Beach has always been rough & wild unlike the beautiful beaches on the south coast and has always had quite a lot of rubbish and litter from fishing boats and littering locals. Negombo council really does seem to be trying to clean it up. Around breakfast time you can see tractors going back and forth smoothing the sand. It’s good since the beach is interesting for a walk with plenty going on out to sea, even if too rough and murky for swimming. Now they’ve just got to drive away the hawkers and voyeurs!
This beach is close to the main Katunayaka  international airport in Srilanka. A good beach there are hotels and  a wide selection of restaurants around here.

Very disappointed by the state of this beach. Lots of locals hanging around, including quite a few drunks. Rubbish and broken glass. Sea is rough and quite a lot of pollution along the shore line. The only good thing is the view out to sea with fishing boats coming and going.
Really nice place, nice beach with many dogs, but with very but very hot watter in the ocean. There is no relaxing swimming possible. But really strange the wave. Only for good swimmers.
its a quite and clean beach. there are fishermen shacks around. beautiful sunsets can be witnessed from here.

Very interesting place. Its is a beach but there is something special. This is first family trip abroad and the first beach visit abroad. Although you see people playing in and around the beach still you feel at peace and undisturbed. A good place to have a walk. However, I would not recommend to venture deep inside the sea as the tides looked rough.The sun set and early morning boats coming back to shore is something to watch.
Handy to airport. Nothing special about the beach except the fishing boats cruising the ocean. Great sun sets but has a dirty beach certain times of the year. Handy to Colombo also.

Interesting place. away from busy  colomboo. Good lots of hotels with beach at the back of it. Nicde food. Good Buddha temples. We visited some good Hindu temples. It was satisfying to stay at Negamboo.

Walked along the beach for some distance this morning and while i felt it had great potential it was also quite dirty with lots of rubbish either washed up from the ocean or left by tourists and locals. This takes away from the beach itself.  The locals were very friendly and this always makes things better.
I am very unsure about Negombo Beach as it’s good for a sunset walk or a general walk but the sea is rough and there is tons of rubbish on the beach.
Overrated beach it is quite dirty and too rough for swimming. Lots of fishermen and local boys playing cricket.

Wouldn’t want to relax here and definitely wouldn’t swim here considering how much rubbish was on the beach. Very sad!! The surrounding hotels really need to start making an effort to clean the beach. There’s some fishing boats which make it more interesting to walk along.

The beach of Negombo is large, with goldi sands, but unfortunately dirty. It Coul be nice but the people have to respect more the beach(a lot of plastic and glass waste).The sunset on the Indian ocean an incredible experience!
only visited as part of a city trip from Villa Hundira on the lagoon. Not very impressed by the beach in comparison with others and glad we didn´t stay in one of the many huge beachside hotels

Nice beach, quiet busy with locals and lucky lucky men all over, they approach you and do leave when you tell them no 3 times but then the next one comes along selling the same things! The sea was extremely choppy !
The beach is ok but there not many facilities. Only the front beach hotels offer food or drinks. The beach is visted by locals specially in the weekends. Then you can get some street food.

Stayed here for the night before our flight out the next day. This place is filthy. Dirty, dirty beach. First place in Sri Lanka that I didn’t feel particularly safe. Locals drunk, shouting at foreigners. Shame to finish on what has been the best holiday ever where the Sri Lankan people have been so kind and friendly. Would not recommend, stay another few hours in Colombo.

Nice beach and no trouble swimming since there is a nice sandy beach. Many sellers though and on Sundays a lot of locals and big parties. It's right windy but at the same time cooling. Well worth a visit and a dip in the ocean.
Nice beach with lot of activity. If you check in to one of the hotels, you will get a private beach...

It’s definitely not the nicest beach in Sri Lanka. Waves are strong and currents also! Plus not the nicest sand to lay down and water to swimming. No shades and it’s pretty dirty over there. The Negombo town is a bit overpriced. It’s a good stop over to the airport.

The beach is quite dirty... very sad because it’s beautiful place! Many fisherman around, so you can see the nice fishing boats and cannons! That’s very cool! You can also fine very good restaurants around with very good seafood!

I visited here on Buddh Poornima, and  the Sinhalese new year festival was full on. All the locals were out there singing, dancing and enjoying the moment. Nice clean and rocky beach. Dont forget to relish some local food flavours selling on wheel carts by locals and especially the elephant ice cream trucks. Though stray dogs could be of little bother here, so be little cautious.

The beach it'self is very long and wide giving u a chance to play some hand ball or football. There is some nice boats on the beach as well. The surf is pretty calm making it good to have a dip. Worth a visit dont spend all holiday hear.

You are fine if you stay inside your hotel’s pool and garden area, but if you step off hotel property onto the public beach you will be met by drunk locals, men leering at Western women in bikinis, men urinating against walls and trees and Rasta beach boys playing loud music. Sri Lanka’s beaches are deteriorating fast and are almost at the tipping point where foreign tourists will recommend against coming here on holiday. Negombo beach is probably the worst for litter and antisocial behaviour. The authorities better get their act together quickly.

Its not the prettiest beach in the world but ita good for people watching. Lots of boats that will take you anywhere. Many locals selling things. They are very friendly and we enjoyed chatting to them. Quite a bit  of rubbish on the beach near where the locals park.

Negombo was our first stop. And the beach was really pretty but there was a flasher showing his thing while there were children and nobody did something about that. but awesome for taking pictures because of all the colorfull fishermen boats.

This hotel is situated approximately 30 minutes from Colombo airport. It's absolute beach front location with direct access to the beach makes it an ideal location for everyone. The hotel is centrally located for access to other facilities in town. The hotel is modern and clean, with 2 restaurants, one on ground floor the other on roof level. Pool looks nice and clean. Rooms are well sized and spacious with quality appointments. Air conditioning works well and view from the balcony is unobstructed to the beach. I recommend this hotel!

The beach is long and wide but the locals have no respect for it. The is rubbish everywhere including broken glass, would not recommend walking here without shoes. Some parts have surf and other parts would be great for swimming if only they bothered to get a rake and clean it up rather than sitting in the huts in the beach all day and drinking

On the last evening in Sri Lanka we went back to stay in Negombo to catch an early flight on the following morning. Before dinner my husband and I went to the beach nearby to see the sunset. On the way to the beach there were literally hundreds of crows sitting on the wires and making a lot of noise. Before we reached the beach we were overwhelmed by the strong smell of rotten sea creatures. When we got there the glorious Sun was about to set as gracefully as ever but the beach was littered with unwanted dead fish everywhere. Some people were even sitting there cutting baskets of fish up, sardines maybe, into small chunks on a chopping board. I don’t know about other parts of Negombo beach but the part we went to was an badly run open factory.

Negombo old town has some nice colonial architecture and it didn’t take more than two hours to see check the sights.  Those who know Galle may find Negombo slightly underwhelming.  The fish market and the beach beyond was the nicest experience in Negombo.  Negombo beaches weren’t particularly nice and they looked very unsafe for swimming.  Negombo food and restaurants were good.  Would only recommend staying in Negombo on the way to or from the airport. One night only.  Max.
We where here around april and the beach was just empty. Its a nice beach for a walk and an quick dive. But its not to be compare with the beaches down south.
Amazing crowd, all families are sitting at dawn and it s popular place to sit and watch or Swim in the waves
A good beach for evening visit.In April scorching sun prevents visitors after 8am.Evening hours are pleasent.

I was staying for 24 hours in Negombo, awaiting my flight home. So I checked out the beach. It's OK... nice sand, water looked clean, and at 9am, not at all crowded. There are a lot of eateries and bars along the beach, but these thin out as you head south. Then nothing much apart from the occasional fishing boat.
The beach was very clean with golden sand. The time we visited the waves were high but we could still enjoy the sea.

Nice beach overall but has to be cleaned, there is lot of garbage on the beach and this attracts lots of crows which are making a lot on noise, especially in the area near the sea view restaurant. They offer free sunbeds and you have also shadow from the above roof, this is to be appreciated.

This beach has areas where it’s clean near the hotels but many areas that are littered with plastic , I actually picked a lot up There are some nice hotels on the beach and more effort slphould be made to clean it they need more bins too
The Beach is A Nice place. And there are Some restaurants. There are Some locals who wants to sell you stuff.

I took a quick walk on the beach but i was not too keen on it as the sand was course, and there were native shacks here and there which did not look so good. There were very few people on the beach, most of them tourists. There were several signs on the beach reminding visitors to behave properly.

Fine brown sand, wide and long beach but totally dirty!  Garbage to be seen everywhere, sick dogs roam around and you know the rest. There are no garbage cans to be seen also. The only clean part is the one in front of the Jetwing hotel because someone’s paid to clean there. Visited there on a holiday and observed people from different religions enjoy with their families and friends. Young boys were playing football, flying kites. Probably the only nice moment there.

Beach clean, not hassled with people selling you things, you can sit in peace and enjoy and relax. there are water activities but large parts of the beach are just clean sand and peaceful, mostly empty of people , you do not need to be near any one, you can sit on your own all day if you choose. Take your own beach towels and beach mats.
Beautiful negombo beach with the tour guide of charith. This man is good so friendly and helpfull try to visit rhis country at negombo sri lanka
Overall the beach was clean of garbage other than shells and a few fish. If you go, watch do the current when you swim for it is pretty strong.

A long beach with areas of litter ( worse after heavy rains). Warm waters for a nice swim but it can get quite rough at times with a heavy back flow of water. Not too many sellers, they tend to stay at the back of the beach near the resorts.

This beach looked very attractive and I think  that I saw it being cleaned first thing. In the morning. There were a few beach sellers wandering up and down but they did not seem too be much of a nuisance and are often pleasant to talk to
While the city itself is sad, the beach is its only redeeming quality. The Sunset was divine and the rocks on the beach are a great place for reflection.
The negombo beach was very empty when we were there due to „off-season“. Also, there was quite some garbage on the beach and jelly fish in the water.
A simple beach walk. Nice sand, warm sea. Spoiled somewhat by litter. As sorry to find a dead turtle, suffered injury to neck.

Stayed with PLedge3 what a fantastic find, you could not ask for more, amazing service, fantastic food and great atmosphere.  Negombo as a location was diverse you seem to be hovering on a growing town, the big hotel chains seem to be springing up, however there is a beautiful self sufficient real Sri Lankan life behind all this. It was great to watch the Sunday cricket, volleyball, and the lively get togethers, having drink at King Coconuts, go and find Josephine one of the beach sellers, she made me laugh so much, everyone comes out for sunset, if you go for an early beach walk you see the fishermen coming in with the days catch and selling on the shore. You have to appreciate the simple way of life however the rubbish and sea pollution surprised me.
